lenders.name: Boitumelo
lenders.occupational_info: Dumela borra le boma! Greetings from Botswana, Africa. My name is Boitumelo Pule, and I am a 45 year old single woman living in the small rural village of Machaneng. I have 4 children, the eldest being 25 and the youngest being 14. Education and personal development have always been a priority in our family. My eldest sons have all completed either university or technical schools, while my youngest son recently received eight academic and extra curricular awards at his secondary school. While raising four talented yet charmingly adventurous sons, I made time to run my own small business. For the past few years I have been using my own personal funds to sell second hand clothes to the people in surrounding villages. While the demand for affordable, high quality clothing in a relatively impoverished area such as ours is consistent, the overhead for procuring and vending these items often leaves my profitless. My goal is to expand my business, buy my products in bulk, and service my clients with greater efficiency and quality. The growing social climate in Botswana is one of self sufficiency and creative innovation. I hope my cooperation with the American people will foster a strong and lucrative relationship that will advance both me and my community members. Thank you for your time and support!

lenders.name: Jennifer

lenders.name: Carolina Microfinance
lenders.loan_because: We believe in, and wish to further, this movement!
lenders.occupational_info: The Carolina Microfinance Initiative (CMI) exists as a center to catalyze interest and facilitate action in microfinance on the campus of University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. We are a seedbed for the growth of industry knowledge and we are a call for the informed engagement of our community in the world at large.

lenders.name: Beathe Helen
lenders.loan_because: I get to lend a helping hand.

lenders.name: Colleen
lenders.loan_because: people trying to better themselves are  inspiring by their effort!  Although I cannot loan much at a time, I am grateful I am in a place in life that I may help and I am grateful for the spark of inspiration that the efforts of these entrepreneurs kindle in my own soul.
lenders.occupational_info:
I loan in honor of my family - those that came before me, my current family, and for all of those that will come after me!

I am only one, but still I am one. I cannot do everything, but still I can do something; and because I cannot do everything, I will not refuse to do something that I can do. 
Helen Keller

lenders.name: Jill
lenders.loan_because: The people who want to borrow through Kiva are hard workers who just need a helping hand to support themselves, their children and families.  I respect that and I am proud to be a small part of that help.  The world needs more helping hands.
lenders.occupational_info: The hardest and most rewarding job I have is mother to a son with special needs.  I spent many years as a legal child advocate, representing abused or neglected children in court to protect them.

lenders.name: Eldon
lenders.loan_because:
in the words of  Samuel P. Putnam (1838-1896),he don't:

WHY DON'T HE LEND A HAND?

You say there is a God
Above the boundless sky,
A wise and wondrous deity
Whose strength none can defy
You say that he is seated
Upon a throne most grand,
Millions of angels at his beck . . .
Why don’t he lend a hand?

See how the earth is groaning,
What countless tears are shed,
See how the plague stalks forward
And brave and sweet lie dead.
Homes burn and hearts are breaking,
Grim murder stains the land;
You say he is omnipotent . . .
Why don’t he lend a hand?

Behold, injustice conquers;
Pain curses every hour;
The good and true and beautiful
Are trampled like the flower.
You say he is our father,
That what he wills doth stand;
If he is thus almighty
Why don’t he lend a hand?

What is this monarch doing
Upon his golden throne,
To right the wrong stupendous,
Give joy instead of moan?
With his resistless majesty,
Each force at his command,
Each law his own creation . . .
Why don’t he lend a hand?

Alas! I fear he’s sleeping,
Or is himself a dream,
A bubble on thought’s ocean,
Our fancy’s fading gleam.
We look in vain to find him
Upon his throne so grand,
Then turn your vision earthward,
‘Tis we must lend a hand.

‘Tis we must grasp the lightning,
And plow the rugged soil;
‘Tis we must beat back suffering,
And plague and murder foil;
‘Tis we must build the paradise
And bravely right the wrong;
The god above us faileth,
The god within is strong.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm retired from teaching law at the University of South Carolina Law School.

lenders.name: Grant
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves an opportunity to succeed.
lenders.occupational_info: I help companies make better, faster business decisions by making use of information they store in their computer databases.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a high school student in Texas which is alot of work with AP classes and french classes. But it can also be alot of fun.

lenders.loan_because: I want to irradicate world poverty and I believe microfinance is the most sound means of doing so.

lenders.name: Sally
lenders.loan_because: this is a wonderful way to encourage and stimulate entrepreneurs - everywhere! My start at my first business came from family and a commercial bank. I know how difficult it can be to get start-up and expansion funds.
lenders.occupational_info: Right now I volunteer at state parks, the local library, Habitat for Humanity, Community Emergency Response Teams and serve on a couple of NFP boards.

lenders.name: psam
lenders.loan_because: There was a time that I needed a loan and no lending institution would help me.  A friend loaned me the money I desperately needed.  I'm passing on the gift of friendship.

lenders.name: Donna
lenders.loan_because: I know it can be hard to achieve your dreams and sometimes all it takes is someone to give you a chance and lend you a helping hand.
